documents.document: @ShakingStick I'm starting to think the "NZ never appears on maps" thing is a conspiracy to keep us exclusive for the cabal.

@MrMegamowman He was average sized, pictured librarians were very wee.
@ShakingStick Not sure why we go through this dance each time. If a party doesn't explicitly rule out coalition w NZF answer doesn't matter.
@LI_politico Yeah, I really don't. This is the test, and I think Labour will fail it.
It'll be good to hear English unequivocally apologise for this, but I wonder if Labour will push it at all. https://t.co/OaeVVavhSt

I've yet to hear any NZ politicians pay their respects to Benjamin the Devonport Library Cat. Shameful.
@BruceBuckman I haven't minded them, but GotG and Dr Strange have definitely been highlights. Avengers could be smarter about being topical.
@BruceBuckman I suspect it's the influence of Marvel HQ. CW was the baby of many folks there as a way to enhance cross-title sales.
@BruceBuckman I'd only have a quibble with the word "boring". Still significantly better than the comic book arc tho.
Ang Lee's Hulk was the best in-universe exploration of the source and implications of Hulk's powers. https://t.co/kixROeqXSZ
@GrumpyYetAmusin @tinycliffe @fancylettuce If men had made them, they've have been hyperrealistic labias even if they were meant to be cats.
@tinycliffe @fancylettuce I always thought they were like cargo doors on a spaceship.
@IainLG With most immigrants settling in Auckland, and Auckland seeing disproportionately high job growth other factors are clearly at work.
@IainLG I wouldn't make that link without more info. Also worth noting that we'd expect very recent immigrants to be short term unemployed.
@IainLG What are you basing that on? The article you link doesn't make that claim.
I'm all for the future, but fucking hell. https://t.co/z25t1Z9jFT

@mfyfyr This guy was what happens when ad execs thought they were Don Draper, but had never written or designed a thing.
@gtiso @mfyfyr Apparently that's illegal. (I checked.)
@mfyfyr One of my old managers would say, "Make it pop!" You mean brighter? "No, pop." More contrast? "No." "Bigger?" "No." "Wording?" "No!"
@mfyfyr I'm betting some intern got handed the original concept brief, and just copied them literally into the design.

Good work, Bill. You've done us all proud. https://t.co/aODSCR4UV0
@thelittlepakeha Exactly. Refugee programs are based on need, not some economic calculus.
That won't invalidate refugee programs at all, but we need to be ready for it. Holding refugees to a higher standard is misguided.
One thing I bring up occasionally: highlighting that refugees are model citizens will backfire. At some point a refugee will lash out.
@simonpnz This modern fascism doesn't even have an intellectual basis to argue against anyway. It's "Strength good, diversity bad."
@thomasbeagle Thanks, that's really useful! I've had the Galaxy S6+ Edge for a year and acclimatised to its quirks.
@missmelissaruth As others have pointed out, more Americans are killed by toddlers with guns than terrorists.
@thomasbeagle I think I can cope with that. Pity I can't try it out for a week and see.
@ThatDamnRanga I think I can live with that. I'm worried about Google-specific apps but I'm looking up each in turn and they seem OK.
Has anyone switched from Android to iPhone recently? I'm thinking about it, but I want to know what I lose with my Google Play services.
@glcarlstrom I really don't know how to tell between deliberately dumb and accidentally dumb anymore.
@thelittlepakeha To a degree. It'll be more of the same rather than suspending elections, martial law, etc.
I'm a cynic. I don't think Bannon, et al is planning a coup d'etat because I don't think they need to. Existing system has enough latitude.

@ShakingStick The thing where people are being coerced into giving up their green cards is permanent, though.
@_hi_tide True. Historically NZF has been largely undisruptive when in coalition, which is enough of a compromise for many voters.
@mizjwilliams @LewSOS Every spy thriller with sleeper agents that I've seen has ended the same way. Infiltrating NZF requires a Gold Card.
(Also ffs I can't believe I got something of value out of a Tory blog post that flirts with the "clash of civilizations" concept.)
@mizjwilliams @LewSOS It's clearly a long con. The longest. He's our secret agent.
Commentary wants a scrappy, pugnacious LotO and compares performance against that, but a PM in waiting can't be that person.
That distinction between what makes a good Leader of the Opposition vs a good PM strikes me as a central problem with media coverage.
I linked to Simon Upton's 2001 blog yesterday, but I keep coming back to this bit: https://t.co/XvImcTXozK
@LewSOS Such that Trump even had a coherent argument for it, it's also one of the justifications he used.
@matthewjpb That figure also seems to be highly suspect. Not based on any published sources vs much higher counts on the ground.

Actually, it's worth pointing out we get these pieces even though she lost.
@LI_politico Silly. Didnt he know you only have to represent the people that vote for you?
It's almost as if the concern isn't bipartisanship, but the feelings of conservatives and racists.
If Hillary had won by 1%, or 10%, we'd have endless "When will she reach out to Trump voters?" pieces. Funny how that only works one way.
@mokai77 Tbh I'd be in exactly the same state.
@DoctorJeph He tries. Oh my god does he try.
@thelittlepakeha @ShakingStick Also terrified of stairs and germs, but loves pee. English could've got that from his GCSB file.
